meanings.definition: The quality or state of having two modes or forms.
meanings.sent1: The bimodalities of the data set show two clear patterns.
meanings.sent2: The bimodalities in the survey results indicate two different preferences.
meanings.sent3: The bimodalities of the weather forecast made planning a picnic tricky.
meanings.sent4: Her mood displayed bimodalities, shifting between extreme happiness and deep sadness.
meanings.sent5: The bimodalities of the traffic flow were evident during rush hour.

meanings.definition: The presence of two distinct peaks or maxima in a frequency distribution.
meanings.sent1: The graph displayed clear bimodalities with two distinct peaks.
meanings.sent2: The bimodalities in the histogram highlighted two prominent spikes.
meanings.sent3: The bimodalities of the cake's height after baking were unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The bimodalities of customer complaints showed peaks during lunch and dinner hours.
meanings.sent5: The bimodalities of student test scores revealed two separate groups of performance.
